page.title: 05Interesting Places,Combwich.
page.content: {Combwich Ponds. In mid twentieth century this area was the centre of a clay industry.Huge amounts of clay were extracted to make tiles and bricks.The large deep and dangerous pond next to the housing estate is an abandoned clay pit.It is not safe for swimming or boating,but it has an abundance of fish and wildlife.Pontoons dotted around the edge of the Ponds are used by anglers. {Hill House.} In 1766 a Georgian House was built for the Evered Family on a hill close to Combwich.It became St. Hilda's School in 1935.In 1976 it was taken over by the Bristol Christian Youth Trust as a centre for children(11-18 years old). With 15 acres of land,there are facilities for swimming,tennis,camping adventure activities and wildlife studies.
